content: @Grahame Grieve I'm getting a bunch of bad links on files I haven't changed since my last commit. Maybe an issue with the latest publisher? http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/qa.html

same here ...

The profile rendering is creating a bad link using the baseurl to the R4 base instead of the IG profile's base as defined in the profile:

    <baseDefinition value="http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-notifications/StructureDefinition/notifications-messageheader"/>

so the result here: 

... error   The link 'http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/StructureDefinition-notifications-messageheader.html' for "NotificationsMessageHeader" cannot be resolved

for the base in the rendered tree view as show below:
source: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-alerts/branches/master/StructureDefinition-admit-notification-messageheader.html#02e7a199-7096-4fdc-b2e0-4f55028137b8

QA-error.png
@Sarah Gaunt the first 3 links are in markdown (manual) and point to content that doesn't exist
Thanks -will check them out. The others though, that are the same pattern as the ones Eric mentioned, are publisher issues?
Thanks for fixing - errors are gone now.
@Grahame Grieve Getting lots of similar errors to those we had before since latest IG publisher: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/branches/master/qa.html#internal
Looks like these are fixed with the latest IG Publisher release - thanks @Grahame Grieve !
